Package model

Class Inventory

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Inventory
  • public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
    The Inventory class stores Part and Product objects for the application and provides methods for adding, modifying, deleting, looking up, and tracking Part and Product objects.
    Author:
    Billy Daniel

      • addPart

        public static void addPart​(Part newPart)
        Adds a Part object to the inventory.
        Parameters:
        newPart - The Part object to be added to the inventory.

      • updatePart

        public static void updatePart​(int index,
                              Part selectedPart)
        Updates an existing Part object in inventory. This method will seek out any Products that are associated with the Part and ensure their object references are updated so the Part object details are consistent between the Inventory Parts list and any associated Product Parts list.
        Parameters:
        index - The location of the Part object in the allParts ObservableList that is to be updated.
        selectedPart - The updated Part object which will replace the existing Part object.

      • deletePart

        public static boolean deletePart​(Part selectedPart)

        Deletes a Part object from inventory if it is not associated with any Product in inventory.

        RUNTIME ERROR: My first version of this method iterated through the allParts list using an enhanced for-loop. When I attempted to remove a Part object from the list during iteration I encountered a ConcurrentModificationException. I learned this was because you cannot modify a collection while iterating through it using a for-loop because it can produce undefined behavior. However, an Iterator may be utilized which allows the list to be updated as you are iterating through it using the Iterator.

        Parameters:
        selectedPart - The Part to be deleted from inventory.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the deletion was completed successfully.

      • isPartAssociated

        public static boolean isPartAssociated​(Part partToCheck)
        Returns true if a Product in inventory is associated with the specified Part object.
        Parameters:
        partToCheck - The Part object which will be checked for in all Products' AssociatedParts lists.
        Returns:
        True if the specified Part is associated with a Product in inventory.

      • getAllPartAssociations

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> getAllPartAssociations​(Part partToCheck)
        Returns an ObservableList containing references to all Product objects that are associated with the specified Part object.
        Parameters:
        partToCheck - The Part object which will be checked for in all Products' AssociatedPart lists.
        Returns:
        An ObservableList containing references to all Product objects that are associated with the specified Part object.

      • lookupPart

        public static Part lookupPart​(int partId)
        Searches for a Part in inventory whose ID matches the supplied ID. If a matching Part is found then a reference to the object is returned. Otherwise, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        partId - The Part ID to look up.
        Returns:
        A reference to a Part object if a Part is found. Otherwise, null.

      • lookupPart

        public static Part lookupPart​(java.lang.String partName)
        Searches for a Part in inventory whose name matches the supplied name. If a matching Part is found then a reference to the object is returned. Otherwise, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        partName - The Part name to look up.
        Returns:
        A reference to a Part object if a Part is found. Otherwise, null.

      • getAllParts

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getAllParts()
        Returns an ObservableList containing references to all Part objects in inventory.
        Returns:
        An ObservableList containing references to all Part objects in inventory.

                                 Product selectedProduct)

        Parameters:

        selectedProduct - The updated Product object which will replace the existing Product object.

      • deleteProduct

        public static boolean deleteProduct​(Product selectedProduct)
        Deletes an existing Product from inventory if it does not have any associated Part objects.
        Parameters:
        selectedProduct - The Product to be deleted from inventory.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the Product was successfully deleted. Otherwise, false.
